Description
Intuit TurboTax Data Science Lab is hiring a senior level Associate Data Scientist to focus on our Consumer Tax Group. We are looking for some exceptional talent that can improve the bottom lines of our TurboTax offerings. We are looking for our Data Scientist to increase awareness across our products as they drive insight into data. This role is critical to ensure that we can partner with our various business teams and in order to change the customer experiences in our flagship TurboTax web products.
Responsibilities:
Having a wide-latitude in determining objectives and approaches to solution development on mission critical assignments
Going beyond established analytical thinking and problem-solving by applying creativity to unconventional concepts and out-of-the-box solutions
Be part of a dynamic and cohesive team of highly trained and successful researchers
Independence in the shaping and development of projects
Ability to quickly understand patterns within large quantity of data and to reference key characteristics using visualization techniques
Demonstrating programming skills in large-scale data analysis using Python, Java, R or related software
Leveraging strong math skills and statistical knowledge to advanced data mining and data analysis activities related to next generation Cloud technologies
Qualifications
MS in Engineering Mathematics, Statistics, Theoretical/Computational Physics, or related field
Solid knowledge of statistical techniques is required
Hands-on programming experience with one or more of the following: Python, Java, R, or related languages
Familiarity with manipulating large datasets and using databases (e.g. SAS, R, SQL, S-Plus, etc.)
1-3+ yearsâ€™ experience with a general-purpose programming language (e.g. C, Java, Python, etc.)
Familiarity with basic principles of distributed computing and/or distributed databases (Hadoop, NoSQL, etc.)
Demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts---all the way down to the theoremsâ€”and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues
Strongly Preferred Qualifications:
PhD in Engineering Mathematics, Statistics, Theoretical/Computational Physics, or related field
Proven experience with Machine Learning techniques, especially on large scale datasets
Demonstrable skills in creative-problem-solving of complex and advanced technical subject matter
Strong interpersonal and communication skills in order to effectively contribute to technical teams and make presentations to a variety of technical and business personnel

Description
We have an exciting opportunity as a Business Data Analyst on a team that is defining how we use analytics to transform customer experiences, accelerate business growth and optimize ROI. We are looking for a data-driven analyst with excellent analytical skills and web analytics experience.
Responsibilities:
Partner with product managers, marketing, and engineering to enable decision support and key customer insights through web tracking metrics
Study website behavior patterns using site metric tools to analyze and optimize business results and user experience
Uses quantitative data gathered with software measurement tools, traffic extracts, click streams and drill-downs to develop an understanding of customer behavior, demographics and lifecycle
Leverage customer insights to recommend test plans across targeting parameters, value proposition and success criteria
Provides guidance to business stakeholders on what data to capture, how to map data needs to business questions, and how to prioritize analysis work while partnering with our data experts to execute
Coordinates report requirements with internal customers to meet business objectives
Applies statistics-based market intelligence to business issues and formulates recommendations
Typically requires proficiency in web analytics applications, strong database skills and technical understanding of website architecture
Create dashboards by pulling data from different sources and present them to management team
Collaborate with external partners such as Agencies to assist with data collection and reporting
Ensure site tagging is optimized to provide crystal-clear visibility into the impact and value of new features, initiatives and product releases
Pursue data quality, troubleshoot data validation, and see issues to resolution
Answer ad-hoc analytic questions and train users to self-serve standard reports leveraging Tableau
Qualifications
2-4 years of experience in web analytics decision support and website optimization for online/ecommerce businesses
Deep subject matter expertise with SQL, Tableau, SAS/SPSS/R and Omniture Site Catalyst.
Understanding of complex web ecosystems, best practices, and ability to put this knowledge into action
Ability to tell stories with data, educates effectively, and instills confidence in recommendations, motivating others to act on them
Strong analytical and problem solving skills: able to develop and use structured approaches to identify root causes and recommend resolutions: can present results in meaningful terms
Project Management skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Description
Come join Intuit as part of the Small Business Group division, Risk Data Analytics team as a Data Engineer. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion for innovation to join our team and revolutionize the way the world does business.
This position includes the following major areas of activity:
Work with payments analytical teams:
Partner closely with Marketing, BU Analytics and Finance teams to define and implement metrics that predicts and monitors the health of the business
Translate business requirements and technical requirements, provide prototypes for solution implementation and assist in the development and testing of data summary tables (aggregates)
Ensure integrity of analysis and reporting data by validating the aggregate data with the source data systems
Build mechanisms to monitor and detect data problems that directly and indirectly impact the business and finance metrics
Proactively manage communications between Marketing/BU Analytics/Finance teams and the Risk Data Analytics Team
Relational database activities using SQL Server 2014 platform:
Identify data sources needed for analysis and decision making
Automate routine procedures, data extracts and reports
Develop, analyze and tune SQL queries for optimal performance
Provide Methodology, Data Mining and Analytical capabilities:
Develop tools using the SQL Server platform that allow analysts to access data and perform routine data analysis
Create comprehensive reports using SQL Server Reporting Services, Excel and Tableau
Perform complex data analysis, data modeling and data mining using SQL, Excel and Tableau
Design, develop and QA dashboards in Excel, Reporting Services, Tableau, Business Objects and SharePoint
Skills:
Technical â€“ Can work with Business Intelligence and Reporting applications; automate routine procedures
Software Development â€“ Strong knowledge of SQL Server 2012, Excel, Tableau
Analytics â€“ Experience in analyzing data, drawing appropriate conclusions, ability to effectively translate statistical findings to business strategies that positively impact the business and the customer
Data Mining â€“ Is comfortable working with large volumes of data, discovering trends and relationships between different pieces of information
Communication â€“ Demonstrate persuasive written and verbal communication skills with ability to establish logical flow and story to present complex information in an easy to understand manner
Interpersonal/Team Skills â€“ Ability to work well with others, not just at a social level, but by building bridges and sometimes confronting tough issues that need to be resolved for the benefit of the business
Personal Traits â€“ High degree of Initiative, Integrity, Outspoken, Driven (while being a team player) and Strong Attention to Detail
Qualifications
Advanced skills in SQL Server 2012 or higher, MS Excel
Bachelorâ€™s Degree or better in Computer or Information Science
Prior Experience with Data Analysis and Reporting
4+ Years Relevant Work Experience
Preferred:
Advanced skills in SQL Server 2104, SQL Reporting Services, Excel, Tableau and Business Objects
Higher education in Computer Science or Mathematics
3+ Years work experience in Payments or Financial Services

Description
After more than 30 years, Intuit continues to transform business and financial management for small and mid-sized businesses, corporate workgroups, consumers, and accounting professionals. The company is currently going through a fundamental transformation from a SaaS software company to one of the countryâ€™s leading providers of cloud based data driven product architecture solutions. Intuit has the richest set of financial data to leverage for data driven products available anywhere within in the market today. We are focused and driven to drive breakthrough product benefits via data. Intuit's Data Services team, provides and uses data to help our customers and Intuit make and save money. We accomplish this through people, processes and technologies that Create Delight, Find Predictive Insights, Improve Business Intelligence, and Enable Better Decisions & Deliver Growth. This team is a group of 100+ high caliber engineers and data scientists who work closely to get Intuit durable competitive advantage through data. The wealth and variety of data in Intuit is very unique, which brings lot of opportunities in terms of driving and influencing Intuitâ€™s product design, marketing and care strategy. Intuitâ€™s vision is to be the Operating system of small business and Do the nationâ€™s taxes by building an ecosystem of Intuit Offerings. Intuit is one of the early adopter and contributor of open source big data technologies. In order to enable this vision, data services team is working on building the next generation analytical data platform on open source Big Data tech stack. At Intuit, we strongly believe that open source technologies provide agility, flexibility and innovative ways to solve the problem at an accelerated pace and lower cost. Our decisions to select any open source technology is not based on published metrics but we do a very thorough evaluation and benchmarking for comparing open source products. Engineers have the lab environment to play with latest technologies, run performance test and test the limits. Engineers at Intuit Data Services are very active in the open source community and contribute patches/enhancements back to the community (Hadoop, Samza, PIG, Sqoop, Storm, Cassandra, HBase etc). Even though we have been active in open source community, we strongly believe that Intuit can contribute in a bigger technology way to the open source community. We are looking for data team to be an Industry data leader when it comes to creating, adopting and contributing towards open source. This team is also required to work across the whole of Intuit and spread the awareness and adoption of these technologies. Our engineers use their Unstructured Time to work on open source technologies not with the mindset of just using that, but understanding the core architecture and come up with ideas on how to make it even better and share that back with the world! Responsibilities:
Hands on experience in BigData space (Kafka, Storm, Hadoop Stack like M/R, HDFS, Pig, Hive, HBase, Flume, Sqoop, etc..NoSQL stores like Cassandra, HBase etc)
Designing, integrating and documenting technical components for seamless data extraction and analysis on big data platform
Passionate for continuous learning, experimenting, applying and contributing towards cutting edge open source technologies and software paradigms
Ensuring best practices that can be adopted in BigData stack and share across teams and BUs.
Provides operational excellence through root cause analysis and continuous improvement for BigData technologies and processes and contributes back to open source community.
Contributes to innovations that fuel the growth of Intuit as a whole
Qualifications
Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, or related discipline with 2-4 years experience.
Experience in BigData stack (Kafka, Storm, Hadoop, HDFS, MapReduce, Pig, Hive, Sqoop, HBase, Cassandra etc)
Experience in engineering large-scale systems in a product environment is required.
Programming experience with Java

Description
Intuitâ€™s Payments Strategic Risk team is tasked with building, protecting and expanding Intuit's competitive advantage and customer experience in our approach to risk management. We intelligently manage risk, shaping strategy to drive better business decisions for our internal and external environment. Specifically we protect Intuit from losses due to fraud and other financial risk by combing through data to find hidden patterns and then building decision systems to act on those insights.
Come join the Strategic Risk team as a Data Scientist.
Responsibilities:
Develops and maintains cutting edge loss prevention products and techniques
Builds and maintains a set of models that provide relevant, timely, and actionable scores based on merchant, batch, and transaction riskiness (e.g. likelihood that they are either fraudulent or financially risky)
Provides guidance and support to Business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
Leads the full cycle of model building to ensure that we incorporate the latest technology, tools, and methods along with the latest industry trends and Intuit-specific merchant behavior
Uses considerable expertise and independent judgment in collaborating with peers, data engineers, database managers, risk operations partners, and business analysts in designing and implementing the strategy needed to methodically and iteratively structure, test, validate, and communicate data-driven insights from complex sources and significant volumes of data for complex and unique business problems
Applies proven methods in working with divergent data types, data scales, and big data, to explore and extrapolate data-driven insights using advanced, predictive statistical modeling and testing applied to data acquired and cleansed from a range of sources
Develops algorithms that result from the validation of hypotheses, and contribute to useful predictions and insights
Provides input into risk policy decisions and strategies
Manages a growing team of data scientists to build and maintain the models and provide business partnership with key stakeholders â€_ accountable for hiring, mentoring, performance management, and directing the work of others
Qualifications
Skilled in analyzing data and drawing appropriate conclusions. Able to effectively translate statistical findings to business strategies that positively impact the business and customer.
Can work with Database and Statistical applications; can automate routine procedures and create tools that increase productivity and efficiency.
Ability to work productively with others, not just at a social level, but by building bridges and sometimes confronting tough issues that need to be resolved for the best of the business.
High degree of Initiative, Integrity & Curiosity for understanding patterns and behaviors through the use of data
Advanced degree (or equivalent) in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics, an MBA, or in Computer Science with Modeling/Data Science coursework
PhD in Quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics, or in Computer Science with Modeling/Data Science coursework preferred
5+ Years Work Experience in Related Field/Position including experience with building predictive models and Data Analytics
Work experience in Financial Services with Payments experience preferred
Experience mining data with Machine Learning Techniques
Experience in R
Experience integrating models into production processes
Advanced SQL skills
Knowledge of QuickBooks data or Clickstream data would be an asset
Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune's â€œ100 Best Companies To Work Forâ€ù and Fortune Worldâ€™s â€œMost Admired Software Companiesâ€ù lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumer and small businesses and their customers worldwide.
Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market -- from QuickBooksÂ®, and TurboTaxÂ® to Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.
Discover what itâ€™s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. Itâ€™s time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: intuitcareers.com EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

Description
After more than 30 years, Intuit continues to transform business and financial management for small and mid-sized businesses, corporate workgroups, consumers, and accounting professionals. The company is currently going through a fundamental transformation from a SaaS software company to one of the countryâ€™s leading providers of cloud based data driven product architecture solutions. Intuit has the richest set of financial data to leverage for data driven products available anywhere within in the market today. We are focused and driven to drive breakthrough product benefits via data. Intuit's Data Services team, provides and uses data to help our customers and Intuit make and save money. We accomplish this through people, processes and technologies that Create Delight, Find Predictive Insights, Improve Business Intelligence, and Enable Better Decisions & Deliver Growth. This team is a group of 100+ high caliber engineers and data scientists who work closely to get Intuit durable competitive advantage through data. The wealth and variety of data in Intuit is very unique, which brings lot of opportunities in terms of driving and influencing Intuitâ€™s product design, marketing and care strategy. Intuitâ€™s vision is to be the Operating system of small business and Do the nationâ€™s taxes by building an ecosystem of Intuit Offerings. Intuit is one of the early adopter and contributor of open source big data technologies. In order to enable this vision, data services team is working on building the next generation analytical data platform on open source Big Data tech stack. At Intuit, we strongly believe that open source technologies provide agility, flexibility and innovative ways to solve the problem at an accelerated pace and lower cost. Our decisions to select any open source technology is not based on published metrics but we do a very thorough evaluation and benchmarking for comparing open source products. Engineers have the lab environment to play with latest technologies, run performance test and test the limits. Description
We have an exciting opportunity as a Sr. Business Data Analyst on our analytics team that is defining how we use analytics to transform customer experiences, accelerate business growth and optimize ROI. We are looking for a data-driven analyst with excellent analytical skills and web analytics experience.
Responsibilities:
Partner with product managers, marketing, and engineering to enable decision support and key customer insights through web tracking metrics
Study website behavior patterns using site metric tools to analyze and optimize business results and user experience

Applies statistics-based market intelligence to business issues and formulates recommendations

Create dashboards by pulling data from different sources and present them to management team

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

jobs_title: Senior Business Data Analyst - SBG Data Analytics & Science (Accountant)
jobs_requirement:
Description
Intuit's Small Business Group Data Analytics & Science group is seeking an analytically minded and experienced Senior Business Analyst with a passion for data analytics within the Accountant segment. The Accountant segment is a fast-growing business with innovative desktop and SaaS products serving Intuitâ€™s most important influencers. Primary responsibilities include analyzing end-to-end accountant marketing and sales data to understand opportunities to drive conversion, retention and attach opportunities for our key products and services. Data types for analysis include in-product data such as clickstream or user-entered data, web data, campaign response data, social/community data, as well as inputs from assisted support channels such as phone and chat. This role would also partner with the Web, Product and Accountant E2E Experience Analytics team members to deliver key insights to the business in order to drive growth and to improve upon key experiences for our Accountant partners. The ideal candidate is self-motivated and experienced in sharing analytical expertise, defining metrics for success and in creating consumable, actionable reporting and analysis. You should be familiar with Customer Relationship Management strategies to help Intuit build and maintain the customer loyalty that underpins our long-term revenue and profitability. The candidate should have experience in building and maintaining CRM metrics from customer data, e.g., Customer Lifetime Value, Customer Acquisition Costs, Churn Models, etc.
Your ultimate goal is to provide relevant data and insights so we can maximize the impact of our marketing and sales efforts to drive more revenue and continue to assist Accountant firms along the journey to become a Firm of the Future. We are looking for an experienced individual who has the passion and experience to help us change the landscape of our marketing and sales efforts and is energized by the opportunities to influence the business by delivering key data, insights and models. Ideally, you will be located in our Mountain View, California Regional office.
Primary Responsibilities:
As a key participant to the success of the Small Business Accountant Segment, drive and contribute to decision-making in support of the critical priorities and overall Intuit Strategy
Lead projects to provide analytic insights that support our business clientsâ€™ needs to drive change. Utilize various analytical methods to provide all stakeholders with analysis, insight and direction that will move the needle on our key business metrics of success. Support your insights with a hypothesis-validation approach with an overall statistically driven framework
Understand and manage data in various forms and channels - marketing contact and response data, web data, sales data, webinar data, in-product data, purchasing history, etc. - both structured and unstructured. Conduct multi-channel sales and profitability analysis, lifetime value considerations, customer profiling, financial / ROI assessment that drive organic growth
Provide analyses to spot trends or assess the response of different campaigns on various customer groups. Correlate customer purchase history with exposure to marketing campaigns or frequency of sales calls, etc. to provide insight into campaign effectiveness. Make recommendations on relationship strategies for different categories of customers or for individual customers. Examples of this are recommending upsell/cross-sell programs based on likelihood of a particular segment to buy
Use your strong communication and presentation skills to identify the business problem or need, negotiate a proposed solution, execute the necessary programming and analytics, present the solution, and track and implement the solution. Be able to present complex solutions at appropriate levels depending upon the audience in question
Contribute to end-to-end problem-solving and strategic support for new business initiatives. Mentor fellow analysts and stakeholders on subject matter knowledge, self-service BI solutions and processes to ensure they are repeatable, sustainable and scalable. Make timely, effective decisions and seek out help to remove roadblocks which stand in the way of delivering against key priorities
Ability to work well with others through strong interpersonal skills and teamwork, not just at a social level, but by building bridges and confronting tough issues that need to be resolved.
Exhibit the capacity or currently possess the skills reflected in Intuitâ€™s Leadership Success Profiles. These include, but are not limited to, 1) working strategically to align with Intuitâ€™s goals, 2) a results orientated passion and decisiveness 3) effective teamwork and career ownership 4) bold creativity and a love for continual process improvement 4) self-confidence and courage with a dose of humility
Qualifications
5 years of relevant business experience
Advanced degree (preferred) in statistics, economics, mathematics, bioinformatics or other related field
Business programming experience in SQL and languages such as SAS, Perl, C++, R and/or big data languages such as Pig, Hive
Strong data visualization skills and experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Qlikview or Tableau, Business Objects, Cognos and Actuate. Tableau and/or Qlikview is a must
Communicates ideas or suggestions to colleagues within and outside BU or Function in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner. Use that communication to influence others to continually solve for the customer, employee, and shareholder
Experience utilizing a variety of basic and advanced predictive analytic tools and techniques including directed and undirected data mining and regression, time series analysis, and text analytics
Understanding of web analytics tools such as Omniture Site Catalyst and Google Analytics
Strong oral, written and presentation skills; ability to communicate across all levels
Previous project, Organization, and time management skills
Teamwork and influencing skills

At Intuit, we strongly believe that open source technologies provide agility, flexibility and innovative ways to solve the problem at an accelerated pace and lower cost. Our decisions to select any open source technology is not based on published metrics but we do a very thorough evaluation and benchmarking for comparing open source products. Engineers have the lab environment to play with latest technologies, run performance test and test the limits. Engineers at Intuit Data Services are very active in the open source community and contribute patches/enhancements back to the community (Hadoop, Samza, PIG, Sqoop, Storm, Cassandra, HBase etc). Even though we have been active in open source community, we strongly believe that Intuit can contribute in a bigger technology way to the open source community. We are looking for data team to be an Industry data leader when it comes to creating, adopting and contributing towards open source. This team is also required to work across the whole of Intuit and spread the awareness and adoption of these technologies. Our engineers use their Unstructured Time to work on open source technologies not with the mindset of just using that, but understanding the core architecture and come up with ideas on how to make it even better and share that back with the world! Responsibilities:
Hands on experience in BigData space (Kafka, Storm, Hadoop Stack like M/R, HDFS, Pig, Hive, HBase, Flume, Sqoop, etc..NoSQL stores like Cassandra, HBase etc)
Designing, integrating and documenting technical components for seamless data extraction and analysis on big data platform
Passionate for continuous learning, experimenting, applying and contributing towards cutting edge open source technologies and software paradigms
Ensuring best practices that can be adopted in BigData stack and share across teams and BUs.
Provides operational excellence through root cause analysis and continuous improvement for BigData technologies and processes and contributes back to open source community.
Contributes to innovations that fuel the growth of Intuit as a whole
Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, or related discipline with 5-8 years experience.
Experience in BigData stack (Kafka, Storm, Hadoop, HDFS, MapReduce, Pig, Hive, Sqoop, HBase, Cassandra etc)
Experience in engineering large-scale systems in a product environment is required.
Programming experience with Java

Description
Senior Technical Analyst, Marketing Technology
Come join Intuit as a Senior Technical Analyst in the Marketing Technology team. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion to deliver data-driven insights. This position works alongside analysts, marketers and data partners to ensure the success of our marketing and advertising programs.
The Role
We are seeking a Senior Analyst who will partner with our marketing and engineering teams to spearhead effective governance and stewardship of marketing technology. The successful candidate will have a strong combination of data knowledge, technical skills and experience with marketing technology tools and processes.
Primary Responsibilities
Work directly with Online Acquisition team that focused on the Paid Search, Display, Paid Social, Paid Mobile and Affiliate marketing platforms to understand channel needs relating to marketing data and technology
Work with product development and data engineers to communicate requirements. Manage the end-to-end development cycle by partnering effectively with engineering and with the broader marketing and analyst community
Be the subject matter expert on marketing technology â€“ including online instrumentation, tag management, data feeds with external partners, and integration of marketing technology across channels
Manage data feeds and own processes to create and activate 1st/2nd/3rd party data-based audiences; audit DMP & audience processes to ensure audience validity
Undertake tag architecture analysis and perform ongoing tag management & governance
Participate in new technology review teams â€“ e.g. DMP/DSP and agency RFP process; lead the implementation of new marketing technology or tools (e.g. web site personalization)
Undertake data analysis and validation, and troubleshoot issues as they arise
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in data analysis or engineering and 3+ years of experience in marketing analytics/technology; experience in advertising technology a plus!
Advanced SQL skills to perform data analysis and validation
Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Sitecatalyst); experience working with granular web clickstream data a plus!
Familiarity with web development and programming or scripting languages (e.g. python, shell scripting); knowledge of HTML & Javascript a plus!
Knowledge of online advertising platforms (e.g. Google AdWords, DoubleClick) and processes, and familiarity with tag management tools (Google Tag Manager or Ensighten)
Outstanding communication skills with the ability to work cross-functionally
Undergrad degree in a quantitative field

Description
This is an exciting time for design research at TurboTax. The Experience Design (XD) research team has joined the XD design studio and is on a mission to push the organization to think differently about solving big customer problems through strategic design research.
We are looking for an ambitious, energetic, and passionate researcher to join our team in conducting impactful research and partnering with senior leadership, design, and product teams to move our business forward.
Responsibilities:
Work with senior leadership, designers, and product teams to identify key research questions and develop smart, effective research plans to gather customer insights
Lead the planning, execution, analysis and synthesis on a range of qualitative research efforts ranging from quick and tactical to deep and strategic
Skillfully facilitate customer interviews to elicit meaningful responses and uncover underlying motivations, values, and mental models
Identify and clearly articulate customer needs, pain points, key tasks, and opportunities through presentations, posters, and other deliverables
Synthesize research findings into concise, actionable insights and meaningful visual frameworks that provoke teams to think differently about the problem and opportunity space
Collaborate with designers and product teams to ideate solutions to big consumer problems and iterate on existing designs
Champions a holistic customer perspective and advocate for the needs of the customer in formal and informal discussions
Collaborate with market research and data analytics to answer complex research questions from multiple angles
Qualifications
BA/BS or equivalent real-world experience
Minimum of 5 years of experience with experience design research in a professional environment
Experience leading a variety of in-lab and contextual qualitative research methods such as usability testing, concept testing, ethnography/contextual inquiry, observation, in depth interviews, diaries/journals, etc.

Description
Intuit is looking for a compliance analyst interested in working with a FinTech leader to help shape its compliance program. In this role, you will learn about the Money Transmitter Licensing and Mortgage Licensing program and helpto execute the day to day responsibilities associated with this program. You will work closely with the Sr. Compliance Program Manager to help shape and execute this program. In addition to the licensing duties, the compliance analyst will assist in developing the overall Intuit Compliance Program. The analyst will work on special projects that include, but are not limited to, monitoring, testing, training, and reporting functions. Additionally, the analyst should be able to create; develop; review; data analytic reports associated with transaction monitoring. The analyst may recommend process improvements that will help to increase efficiency while maintaining compliance program requirements.Primary Responsibilities:- Day-to-day support and management for Companyâ€™s regulatory licensing program (particularly Money Transmitter andMortgage Broker Licenses).- Prepare and finalize Company and Individual state licensing applications, renewal forms, and biographical forms andother regulatory and compliance documents.- Analyze and interpret reporting requirements and work with accounting-reporting staff to complete transactional andreporting forms for multiple licensing programs involving heavy filing calendar, including monthly, quarterly and annualreports.- Track reporting and update regulatory reporting calendar.- Research state banking department websites to download new forms, statutes and rules.- Collaborate and team work with cross-functional teams, including accounting and executive admin staff.- Maintain physical licensing records and electronic records on Quick Base including communications with regulators,reporting records, entity corporate records, and audit records.- Assist with corporate annual reporting for corporate entity foreign registrations.- Assist with maintaining corporate minute books.- Support regulatory audits with preliminary information gathering, document response set up, and preparation ofproduction binders.- Assist with special projects associated with building out the compliance program which include, but are not limited to,testing, training, monitoring, reports, and process improvements.
Qualifications
- General knowledge of compliance programs, BSA/AML/OFAC, and MTL licensing.- Experience in regulatory licensing and compliance support.- CAMS or ACFCS certification.- Strong knowledge of databases or computer languages including R and SQL.- Effective communications, both oral and written, internally and externally.- Advance Microsoft Office software programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Acrobat.- Proficient in Quick Base and NMLS licensing system.- Demonstrate efficient use of time, accuracy and attention to detail.- Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize heavy workloads with critical deadlines.- Ability to recognize situations that require assistance from others.- Maintain a professional attitude, appearance and demeanor.- Ability to handle confidential information in a sensitive manner. If you enjoy working face to face with customers in a fast paced high tech environment then this is the place for you!
The role of Desktop Support Analyst 3 is to help internal employees with all facets of the corporate computing environment. The Analyst must combine an understanding of Macintosh & Windows with firsthand experience. In addition, the Analyst will be looked upon as a technical resource to compliment the manager's expertise for the assigned scope of work. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills combined with technical skills are essential to providing a â€œwhite-gloveâ€ù level of support to the employee community.
Responsibilities
Ability to analyze and troubleshoot software, hardware and connectivity issues and recommend and implement corrective solutions.

Ability to work independently and within a team environment; taking and following directions and completing tasks and assignments in a timely manner and with a positive attitude.
Familiarity with encryption and security tools and triaging within this environment.

Description
The Intuit Global Network Services division is seeking a Principal Network Security Architect who will help us design and build the next-generation infrastructure platform to support our company strategy across a unique set of SaaS based products. The ideal candidate will bring architectural and engineering experience in the deployment and management of the security arena including network, application and operational focuses across network-related technologies and services. Candidate must possess exceptional communication skills and able to interact with both business and technology stakeholders at various levels while applying subject matter expertise for security technologies and solutions.
Responsibilities
Provide technical leadership and â€˜know-howâ€™ in both defining and applying security requirements with sustainable and durable solutions that will scale in a SaaS based environment
Review and recommend tooling and technologies to be deployed for proper security posture to be adhered
Continuously review network security related services and act upon discovered gaps while defining ideal state and how we get there
Act as the subject matter expert for network security related environments to deliver security functions and enhancements while partnering with our Information Security division
Provide expertise and mentoring in support of Network Security operations
Assist in review, evaluation and recommendations of security related Risk Assessments
Skills and Experience
Network Security: Firewalls (next-gen of Layer 7), Web Proxies, IP Network Management, Multiple Vendor technologies (Cisco, PAN, Juniper, Certificate and Key Management vendors) are preferred
Knowledge in applying compliance standards derived from frameworks such as Cloud Security Alliance and PCI DSS
CISSP or other industry certification desired
IDS & IPS knowledge such as Sourcefire and PAN
Cyrpto key and Cert Management knowledge.
DDos incident response and remediation knowledge
Identity and Access Management including areas of controls and governance
Experience in writing network and/or systems security plans for complex information systems; conducting security reviews and audits.
Own and drive the long-term plans around vulnerability assessments and remediation for the Hybrid Cloud infrastructure.
Perform gap analysis of the infrastructure for security compliance
Own and drive the periodical scan using nmap/Nessus or similar tools to identify posture, state and security pulse of the Hybrid Cloud infrastructure environment
Define, develop and publish KPIs for security compliance
Qualifications
Degree in Science with 12+ years of experience
SaaS Engineering & Operations support experience required
Securing Cloud Computing Architectures experience required
AWS experience strongly desired
Expertise in security assessment and penetration testing, including capability to use both automated tools and manual tools (e.g. Kali Linux, Burp Suite, Metasploit, Wireshark) as well as developing custom exploits or reverse engineering if necessary to achieve the penetration goal.
Expertise with network penetration testing, with a focus on Microsoft and Linux Servers
Proficiency in scripting languages (Python, Perl, PHP, Ruby) and compiled languages (C/++/# or similar)
Expertise in security of multiple operating systems, especially: Windows and Linux
Expertise in access control, authorization and authentication technologies: PAM, Active Directory, LDAP, etc.
Expertise in securing fundamental networking protocols: DNS, NTP, HTTP, TCP, UDP, TLS, IPSEC, 802.1x, NFS
Experience with global scale architectures performing security work in a financial or other regulated environment is a plus

Description
This is a multi-dimensional role enabling Small Business Group sales teams to drive selling effectiveness through Salesforce. In the current environment, the role requires domain knowledge of legacy CRM and sales order systems used to complete the full E2E selling experience from lead to close and managing a pipeline. The candidate must be flexible to meet the demands of a highly fluid environment of ongoing systems and process change.
The candidate will be adaptable to operate in multiple systems and energized in helping sales consultants successfully navigate processes and tools to be proficient. The candidate will respond to system issues that the sales consultant experiences and is knowledgeable of support technology teams needed to be effective at triaging an issue. As the sales systems SME, the candidate will be the â€œvoice of the sales teamâ€ù and will submit requirements for new features and process improvements by effectively translating the needs of the sales consultant as well as ensuring their teams are effectively following process. Additionally, the candidate will navigate numerous â€œobjectsâ€ù within Salesforce to create effective dashboards and reports. The role will require tool administrative expertise in lead list imports from marketing and sales initiatives, consultant email template creation, as well as lead assignment and territory assignment tasks. The candidate will be able to flex from tactical to strategic activities daily and be seen as a thought partner with sales leadership.
Responsibilities:
Domain expert in Salesforce and admin support of lead list imports, lead assignment manager, email templates, etc
Understands the multi-product sale and applicable CRM order fulfillment steps integrated/non-integrated in Salesforce
Support will include both technical use as well as business process adherence to ensure consultant proficiency of ongoing monthly feature changes. Works closely with front line sales leader to drive effective use of the system
Manage and maintain reporting tools and handle ad-hoc SF reporting requests (as requested by sales management)
Support Tier 1 level help with EBS and submit Help Desk Tickets or escalation when CRM issues arise
Partner in requirements gathering, prioritization and development for new features and process enhancements with Sales Operations
Be the Salesforce champion for changes, new features, processes, etc. for their team
Participate in Business Admin weekly Community meetings and represent their business team in driving SBG outcomes and furthering the Community expertise
Qualifications
Excellent Communication (written and verbal)
Ability to Influence and Partner for Change
Technical tools savvy â€“ analytic skills a plus
Effective at prioritization and time management
Empathy for their customer; speed to resolve issues (understand their challenges and tool environment)
Experience: Salesforce proficiency required; Salesforce certification a plus

Intuit is a leading software provider of business and financial management solutions for small and mid-sized businesses, consumers, financial institutions and accounting professionals. Description
Intuit Australia landed on Australian shores in 2013 with QuickBooks Online (QBO), providing accounting and business management solutions for small business owners and their advisor. The Intuit Australia team functions very much like a start-up, but is part of Intuit. Intuit HQ is right in the middle of Silicon Valley, in Mountain View, California, and has been in operations since 1983. Intuit has been recognized year-over-year on Fortune's 100 Best Companies To Work For list and at the top of Fortune Worldâ€™s â€œMost Admired Software Companies,â€ù and is also known for coaching world class product managers. Intuit Australia was ranked No. 3 on the Great Place to Work Institute and the Business Review list of Australiaâ€™s Best Companies to Work For in 2015.
If youâ€™re passionate about cloud and mobile offerings and interested in transforming the lives of small businesses and accountants in Australia, come join our team as the Senior Product Manager for QuickBooks Australia. We are looking for a creative problem solver with a passion for innovation. We want someone capable of employing an entrepreneurial mindset and leveraging a broad array of analytical, interpersonal and leadership skills to identify, prioritize, and execute new opportunities to accelerate growth and revolutionize the marketplace.
Come join our team to take your product management skills to the next level, while creating experiences Australian small businesses will love.
Responsibilities
Develop wining strategies and priorities for QuickBooks Australia, leveraging deep customer, product, market and knowledge
Collaborate closely with cross-functional leaders in Australia and the United States
Deeply understand customers and their pain points through methods such as â€œfollow-me-to-the-officeâ€ù visits and in-depth interviews
Know our competitors, their offerings and how our solutions can solve customer needs in significantly better ways
Define innovative solutions for Australia customer needs, using design thinking methodologies and rapid experimentation; be hands-on with our products and hold a high bar for quality
Drive customer empathy, product expertise and competitive awareness throughout the Australia team
Deliver winning offerings by working closely with central product teams in California, USA, as well as working directly with the Australia development team in Sydney to implement Australia-specific functionality
Evangelize the needs of the Australia market to leaders and product teams in the United States
Qualifications
5+ years in a Product Management role designing and delivering world-class solutions that drive customer delight and business growth
Experience working on web (SaaS) and mobile offerings that target small businesses or consumers; experience in the accounting/payroll/payments space a plus
Passionate about unearthing customer insights and championing the voice of the customer
Demonstrated ability to collaborate across functions, locations and cultures to deliver a delightful end-to-end customer experience
Outstanding analytical skills, demonstrated by roadmaps and recommendations, backed by solid business cases
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams, including the ability to think and lead complex projects simultaneously
Excellent communication skills â€“ both oral and written and a track record of gaining the confidence senior management
Hands-on, hard-working, scrappy and even-keeled - energized rather than frustrated by hard problems and surprises
Ability to travel ~10% â€“ within country to visit customers and globally to collaborate with your peers and partners in the United States
Technical degree or MBA a plus

Description
Join the QuickBooks Online team! QuickBooks Online is the leading small business accounting cloud platform, and is one of the most exciting products to work on within Intuit right now. Weâ€™re at the center of Intuitâ€™s strategy, building the operating system behind small businesses worldwide. On top of that, we have a truly awesome team. Here are a few of the top reasons you should consider joining us:
Impact. Youâ€™ll actually be able to feel the impact youâ€™re making on the lives of 1.3M customers that need our product to run their business every day. And that numberâ€™s growing rapidly â€“ weâ€™re hoping to have more than 10 million active users within the next 3 years.
Rockstar team. These are some of the best PMâ€™s youâ€™ll work with â€“ weâ€™re great at what we do. And, weâ€™re kind of fun too (just ask one of our Group Product Managers, who organizes our karaoke happy hoursâ€_)
Strong leadership. The leadership bench on this team is flat out amazing. And because of the strategic importance of QuickBooks Online, we do get a lot of time with them. So if you want to learn about leadership by observing the best of the best in action, this is the place for you.
Another advantage of working on this team is that there are tons of really hard, fun problems to solve, and youâ€™ll have the opportunity to work on many of them by rotating onto different parts of the product. For the first 12-18 months with the QBO team, youâ€™ll be focused on taking a BIG swing at improving the very first impression small business owners have of our product â€“ QuickBooks.com â€“ with a focus on two critical areas:
Transforming the user experience to drive step function growth in the % of QB.com visitors that signup for QuickBooks: Because small businesses are all so different, our leading hypothesis is that we need to deliver a personalized experience using the latest technology so we can highlight the benefits relevant to each small business owner (example: a retailer cares about very different things than a photographer)
Transforming the marketing technology enabling QB.com: There is a big opportunity to create reusable technology to accelerate the speed with which we can build & test new QB.com experiences
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who fits the following description:
First and foremost, you are incredibly curious and have a sense of urgency to move quickly in order to prove/disprove hypotheses.
You are customer-back and data-drivenâ€_ you have a sense of pride in your analytics + A/B testing prowess.
Youâ€™ve got gritâ€_weâ€™re still in the process of transforming QB.com into a true product experience, so youâ€™ll be comfortable with ambiguity and busting down barriers.
Ideally, youâ€™re also coming from a place thatâ€™s best in class at marketing technology, and have a point of view on how it should be done here at Intuit.
Responsibilities:
You will run lean experiments to learn quickly through the lean startup methodology.
You will develop and evangelize a strong point of how to increase QB.com traffic to signup conversion.
You will lead a cross-functional team (including engineering, design, marketing) and influence key partners across teams to develop strong relationships that will allow you to work more efficiently and build trust.
You will use your keen business acumen to set a strategy, influence to gain wide acceptance of that strategy, and then ensure that priorities and tests ladder to business targets.
You will coach/partner with a team of analysts to structure analysis and data to fuel your testing efforts with key insights
Qualifications
Strong leadership skills: Builder of strong teams, solution-oriented, drives through ambiguity, facilitates change management.
Strong strategic thinker with excellent communication skills.
Strong sense of what â€˜world classâ€™ looks like in developing and executing tests + marketing technology, as well as rolling out functional enhancements.
Strong intuition for the consumer Internet, either from work in product management or product marketing.
Strong persuasion skills required. You must be able to frame strategies at multiple altitudes, depending on your audience.
You will own business outcomes and will be responsible for hitting experience and revenue targets by improving and re-imaging the experience for new customers.
BA/BS required.

Description
Intuitâ€™s Enterprise Business Solutions group is seeking a strategic and innovative Sr. Product Manager (PM) for our Sales Technology team. This PM will work with the leaders across Intuit to establish solution roadmaps and with our experience design/development teams to deliver delightful front-line employee and customer experiences using Agile methodology. High energy, self-starter with a bias for action

Description
Come join the Workforce Technology Security group at Intuit! We are looking for a unique individual with a strong security background to bring a product management perspective to our Workforce Security portfolio. As a Product Manager in this team, you will be responsible for a diverse set of security services used by an enormous internal user base.
That includes
Enterprise Identity and Access Management
Multi-factor Authentication
Privileged Access Management
User Certification
Single Sign-On (SSO)
Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB)
Partnering with teams across the company on cross-functional initiatives
The request we get most often from our employees is "Just make it easier". We want to leverage technology to make seamless communication and collaboration possible and we want to make it super simple. Are you someone who can bring a user focus on simplicity to this very complex area? Then let's talk about your next career opportunity!
Responsibilities
Own our security product portfolio
Serve as the product visionary to drive the evolution of the Workforce Security portfolio focused on empowering employees (own the strategy)

Run beta and pilot programs with early stage solutions
Partner across the organization with architecture, InfoSec, Legal, and Platform Infrastructure
Act as a leader and change agent within the company
Stay abreast of the ever changing security landscape, following industry trends and suggesting new areas to investigate or invest
Qualifications
5-7 years of experience working as a product manager in the security space managing a portfolio of products/services that included both vendor-provided and custom-built solutions
Experience with Enterprise Identity and Access management products, services and technologies
Technical understanding of the security space as a whole and the capacity to engage with the architecture and development teams on technical strategies and investments
Seasoned individual contributor with experience defining vision and strategy across more than one product/service
Can combine technical acumen and design thinking to drive alignment with the product development and experience design teams
Data-driven decision maker with experience using data and logic to analyze input and influence outcomes
Experience communicating, influencing and partnering across teams and leading through influence
Experience managing and influencing leading security vendors
Track record of getting deep customer insights and translating them into working product and end-user delight. Demonstrated ability to understand the true â€œwhyâ€ù with regard to user behavior

Description
Come join the TurboTax.com web marketing team as the Senior Product Manager â€“ TurboTax.com Marketing Technologies Platform. Under the direction of the Director of TurboTax.com Product Management, the Senior Product Manager will play a pivotal role in the development and evolution of Intuitâ€™s TurboTax.com marketing website platform and associated technologies. This is an important role with opportunity to drive massive innovation to enable radical new customer experiences and game changing improvements in business agility.
The Senior Product Manager, TurboTax.com is responsible for creating a vision for the future state of the platform on which we build the TurboTax.com website, then defining a roadmap and to achieve the vision and executing delivery with the various TurboTax.com scrum teams.
Responsibilities will include:
Engaging with multiple business stakeholders to ensure all product needs are captured
Deep analysis of customer and site analytics to understand behavior, performance and opportunity areas
Researching competition and customer to understand the market dynamics
Serving as the primary point of ownership and expertise and in 3rd party marketing technologies currently used and recommend opportunities for new vendors
Developing the short, mid and long term product roadmap to deliver capabilities used by experience delivery teams focused on user profile data, content management, tag management and more
Managing program to measure, report on and meet SLAs for site performance

directly support primary objectives of the project
are appropriate in size for iterative development
include clear and specific acceptance criteriatake into account dependencies on other stories and/or projects & initiatives

He/she effectively translates business strategies into product strategies, roadmaps and product specifications that deliver against both our core customer benefits and our company strategic and revenue goals. The Product Manager acts as the product champion, and is able to evangelize the product vision effectively to their team and to senior-level stakeholders.
The ideal candidate has prior experience with a large retail or software site and is capable of picking up new knowledge really fast. He/she is a strategic thinker, is analytical, detail and results-oriented with excellent problem-solving skills and a strong work ethic. He/she is a highly motivated self-starter. He/she is an excellent communicator and builds strong cross-functional relationships. This individual will be skilled in leading an Agile team and working collaboratively with Business Managers, Designers, Web Developers, Engineering, Project Managers, and QA. He/she is able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, at various stages of their development.

5+ years in a Product Management role for a large, online retail website or software company. Experience with mobile web or applications required.

Strong web technology understanding; HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field, MBA preferred
2+ years experience in a Product Owner role using an Agile methodology (Scrum, KanBan or other)
Internet experience required
Strong analytical, prioritization and negotiating skills
Passionate about building great products and solving customer and business problems

Description
Intuit's Enterprise Business Solutions (EBS) group is looking for an Application Operations Engineer at its North California office. EBS Ops team supports production services for Finance and Enterprise Identity and Access Management (EIAM) systems. It includes key Finance systems used to run our business operations and infrastructure where all our customer-facing applications are hosted, ensuring 24x7 availability and fast service restoration in case of any issues/incidents. Intuit is one of the top 100 BEST COMPANIES TO WORK FOR, and the EBS team at Intuit strives to be a world class Operations organization delivering global, always-on, predictable services using optimized processes and structure.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for App Ops- Technical and Functional support- of a wide range of production applications/services including day to day support, weekly/monthly releases/deployments, data fixes, and other regular patching activities
Work closely with Infrastructure team to support ongoing maintenances e.g., migration of apps between/within Data Centers, adding new servers, updating firmware etc and ensure minimal/no impact to customers
You will be a primary contact to resolve production/hosting related issues and expected to work closely with Change Management, Release management, and extended Partner teams for bug fixes, regular deployments etc
Partner with Engineering/Development team(s) to develop appropriate Run-books and for promoting code to different environments as part of periodic release schedule
Should be a quick learner, innovative problem solver, and flexible to adapt new apps and technologies as necessary in line with business needs at EBS/Intuit
Responsible for driving operational excellence across operations in general, and within Finance Ops in particular with a DevOps mindset to bring rigor in Operations
You will be part of rotating On-call schedule to provide 24x7 support(follow the sun model) including weekend support
Applies knowledge of technology and operational best practices to drive design, development and implementation of operational standards and capabilities to enable highly available, scalable & reliable customer services/experiences
Analyzes and synthesizes a variety of inputs to drive end-to-end incident management process to restore service quick and then Root Cause Analysis(RCA) for long term fixes
Developing monitoring architecture and implementing monitoring agents, dashboards, escalations and alerts and a passion for documenting the processes.
Qualifications
BS in Engg/Computer Science with 5+ years of strong Application operations/Dev Ops experience in production support managing Linux/Window environments
Strong in WebLogic/JBoss administration and Apache Tomcat and J2EE deployment preferred
Good in scripting- Shell, Perl, python etc-, SSH, HTTP/S, Networking, and Apache Web server
Expertise in supporting and managing middle tier and app/web tier
Excellent troubleshooting capabilities required, must possess an automation mindset
Should be a strong team player and possess strong communication skills
Must possess ability to work effectively and efficiently in a cross-functional, matrix environment
Technical Skills:
Strong in RedHat Linux, WebLogic/JBoss, Apache, Tomcat, Oracle, and Scripting like Shell or Perl
Monitoring: Splunk, DynaTrace, SiteScope, Spectrum etc
Build and Deployment: Chef, Jenkins, Nexus, Perforce, Maven, GitHub, Perl
Operational support for SaaS based applications is an advantage
Languages: Good in Java/J2EE and Web Services
Troubleshooting production issues- incident and problem management, follow up on defect reporting and resolution status
Experience with Application monitoring -Splunk, DynaTrace, SiteScope etc-, logs management, Oracle DB, NetApp/EMC storage systems, LDAP, Security certificates administration etc
Participation in Root Cause Analysis(RCA) process and contributing to long term fixes
Application deployment plan and implementation including post go-live validations
Configuration of monitoring agents at software layer, and development of meaningful alerts and escalation procedures
Experience with HA/DR/Business Continuity set up is a plus
Experience in fixing security vulnerabilities is a big plus
Experience in AWS environment is a huge plus
Experience working in Identity systems with good hold on tools like OAM, OIM, OSSO, LDAP, PingFederate, etc is a plus
Knowledge of Oracle database operations is a plus

Description
Are you looking for a new challenge? Looking for hard problems to solve?
Be responsible for developing and implementing security solutions for Intuit's next generation cloud hosting environment. An ideal candidate is a creative self-starter with an integrator mindset that can work autonomously to develop creative solutions as part of a cloud security platform. The candidate will work within an engineering team to design, develop, and implement automation to support cloud hosting solutions at scale in support of protecting infrastructure and applications to meet strict requirements for security, functionality, scalability, performance and reliability. Furthermore the candidate must be an expert with a hands-on ability to demonstrate how solutions will work, develop prototypes and assist in large-scale implementation.
This is an exciting position supporting some of our new and emerging initiatives. Youâ€™ll enjoy working with the best and brightest in this space and your efforts will help our teams to learn more as we innovate.
The candidate will have extensive experience working with large-scale applications, virtualization and cloud deployments, while remaining vendor agnostic; skilled in seeing past vendor sales discussions to engineer a durable environment. They should be able to develop custom solutions to help protect applications and infrastructure from common and targeted threat vectors. This person should be an expert with cloud principles like horizontal scale, networking concepts like routing, filtering, and proxy technologies. Interest in how controls will work at a deep level and having extensive knowledge of host and application security controls is a must. The Cloud Security Engineer is able to work well with infrastructure and application teams when integrating security solutions for the cloud, understanding the design and methods required to support reliability, scale and security with a balanced approach.
Qualifications
BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Experience in current technology and trends in the industry (e.g. cloud hosting, big data, mobile, web services, platform technologies, etc.)
7+ years in a security engineering or application security role
6+ years in an enterprise security, software development role or network/system role
Experience working as a security engineer or application security specialist for a large-scale, highly available, software services company
Experience with public cloud environments and technologies, including Amazon Web Services or other
Experience developing or implementing resilient solutions for cloud environments
Experience with private cloud architecture and designing environments to scale
Expert experience in Windows and/or Linux
Must have in-depth knowledge of attacker techniques and tools
Capable of writing signatures or correlation rules to detect threats and identify a compromise
Expert knowledge of cyber security principles and demonstrated experience developing technical solutions that lead the industry
Must possess experience with building partnerships across multiple business units and executing effectively
Strong command of English language (written and oral) at a business level is required
Readiness to become a thought leader for aspects of cyber operations across multiple domains
Ability to work well with multi-disciplinary teams focusing on user and customer needs
Ability to work in a fast paced and collaborative setting, able to engineer systems from the ground up
Strong customer focus with ability to interpret and utilize the data
Must possess strong consulting, documentation and presentation skills
Desire and ability to help grow company's global security operation
Desire and proven experience designing and developing new security services offerings

Description
Come join the Small Business Group (SBG) at Intuit! We're looking for a world class executive to be the Director of Offerings EcoSystem Technologies in our Product Development organization.
Your DNA should be dominated by a love of modern Front End Architecture, and a passion for creating Platform Technologies that directly empower the small business and accountant ecosystems and our roughly 1000 developers.

Description
Are you looking for a new challenge? Looking for hard problems to solve?
Be responsible for developing and implementing security solutions for Intuit's next generation cloud hosting environment. An ideal candidate is a creative self-starter with an integrator mindset that can work autonomously to develop creative solutions as part of a cloud security platform. The candidate will work within an engineering team to design, develop, and implement automation to support cloud hosting solutions at scale in support of protecting infrastructure and applications to meet strict requirements for security, functionality, scalability, performance and reliability. Furthermore the candidate must be an expert with a hands-on ability to demonstrate how solutions will work, develop prototypes and assist in large-scale implementation.
This is an exciting position supporting some of our new and emerging initiatives. Youâ€™ll enjoy working with the best and brightest in this space and your efforts will help our teams to learn more as we innovate.
The candidate will have extensive experience working with large-scale applications, virtualization and cloud deployments, while remaining vendor agnostic; skilled in seeing past vendor sales discussions to engineer a durable environment. They should be able to develop custom solutions to help protect applications and infrastructure from common and targeted threat vectors. This person should be an expert with cloud principles like horizontal scale, networking concepts like routing, filtering, and proxy technologies. Interest in how controls will work at a deep level and having extensive knowledge of host and application security controls is a must. The Cloud Security Engineer is able to work well with infrastructure and application teams when integrating security solutions for the cloud, understanding the design and methods required to support reliability, scale and security with a balanced approach.
Qualifications
BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Experience in current technology and trends in the industry (e.g. cloud hosting, big data, mobile, web services, platform technologies, etc.)
4+ years in a security engineering or application security role
6+ years in an enterprise security, software development role or network/system role
Experience working as a security engineer or application security specialist for a large-scale, highly available, software services company
Experience with public cloud environments and technologies, including Amazon Web Services or other
Experience developing or implementing resilient solutions for cloud environments
Experience with private cloud architecture and designing environments to scale
Expert experience in Windows and/or Linux
Must have in-depth knowledge of attacker techniques and tools
Capable of writing signatures or correlation rules to detect threats and identify a compromise
Expert knowledge of cyber security principles and demonstrated experience developing technical solutions that lead the industry
Must possess experience with building partnerships across multiple business units and executing effectively
Strong command of English language (written and oral) at a business level is required
Readiness to become a thought leader for aspects of cyber operations across multiple domains
Ability to work well with multi-disciplinary teams focusing on user and customer needs
Ability to work in a fast paced and collaborative setting, able to engineer systems from the ground up
Strong customer focus with ability to interpret and utilize the data
Must possess strong consulting, documentation and presentation skills
Desire and ability to help grow company's global security operation
Desire and proven experience designing and developing new security services offerings

Description
Job Title: Sr Developer Evangelist
Location: Mountain View, CA
Description: The Intuit Developer Group enables developers and partners to integrate with rich financial and transactional data through the REST-based APIs of the QuickBooks platform, giving them unparalleled reach to millions of small businesses through QuickBooks Apps.com. The Intuit Developer Group is an integral part of Intuit becoming the operating system for small businesses globally. We are a rapidly growing and expanding platform, and have very ambitious growth objectives. Check us out at developer.intuit.com and developer.intuit.com/hub We are actively seeking an experienced Developer Evangelist to be part of the developer relations team, recruiting, inspiring, and enabling developers to solve big problems for small businesses by building app integrations with the QuickBooks platform. The right person for this role has strong technical skills coupled with a knack and passion for social media engagement, enthusiasm for content development, and ease with speaking 1:1 with developers about opportunities and challenges. You have a passion for technology and sharing it with other inventors, creators, and app developers â€“ both inside and outside the company. Responsibilities This diverse role includes a variety of responsibilities, all focused on growing the Intuit developer community and the QuickBooks app ecosystem. The Developer Evangelist inspires and educates developers around the world to solve problems for accountants and small businesses by integrating apps and technologies with the QuickBooks platform. In this role you will:
Identify and recruit developers to build and publish small-business apps that integrate with the QuickBooks platform
Create engaging technical content for Intuitâ€™s developer community, including blog posts, forum posts, virtual and live presentations, etc.
Write production-quality code to be used as sample apps, workshop tutorials, etc.
Engage with and grow the Intuit dev community using social channels like Twitter, FaceBook, Google+, LinkedIn, etc.
Connect and network with other developers and entrepreneurs to build awareness of QuickBooks platform and how it can be the operating system behind small business.
Share your expertise by speaking formally and informally at user groups, meetups, and conferences.
Support the Intuit developer community wherever they are -- on forums, on social media, at conferences, meetups, hackathons, etc.
Qualifications
Qualifications
The Developer Evangelist is a software developer with a passion for technology, an interest in using technology to solve big problems, who loves to interact and speak with other developers. To be successful in this role, you need:
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
You have created and delivered engaging technical presentations and are comfortable with (and enjoy) public speaking.
You like to write about technical topics and have authored technical content for blogs, forums, etc. and are able to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively.
You love to talk with developers 1:1 and have no problem â€œcold-callingâ€ù them to share the small business opportunity.
Strong and diverse engineering skills (5+ yrs experience as a developer).
You have a solid knowledge of XML (experience using server-to-server web services such as SOAP or REST preferred).
You can demonstrate solid programming abilities in one or more of the following languages: Java, .NET, or PHP.
Strong interpersonal skills, approachable, good listener: At ease speaking with (and learning from) people inside and outside the company about QuickBooks platform and Intuit technologies in an engaging, confident, fluent manner.
Strong collaboration skills: A demonstrated ability to work across functional teams to achieve common goals.
Demonstrated engagement and leadership in developer communities.
Fluent, savvy about leveraging social opportunities to engage and connect virtually and in person.
Willing and able to travel to anywhere our developer communities live, and stay productive and professional on the road.
Willing and able to work irregular hours and some weekends to support hackathons, conferences, user groups, and other developer events.
BA/BS in Computer Science or a similar technical degree preferred.
5 years or more of work experience that supports the goals and requirements of this role.

Description
Wanted: Smart software engineers to create Big Data pipeline validation solutions. Are you an innovative problem solver who is passionate about delighting customers with robust, high-performance, and high-quality solutions? Do you like to work in an agile, collaborative environment where you proactively can make big decisions that really matter? The Intuit Data Engineering & Analytics (IDEA) team is building the data foundation, products and capabilities that enable Intuit to create products and experiences that solve complex and critical problems for our customers. For example, we are developing peta-byte scale big data platforms, large-scale distributed services (i.e. multi-tenant profile services, a commerce graph based upon transactions covering 20% of the US GDP, real-time data capture and audience segmentationâ€_) and data-driven products/applications. Our team uses the leading edge big data technologies like AWS, Spark, Kafka, Cassandra, Hadoop, employs cutting-edge data science methods and continuously experiments with relevant emerging data technologies. We are committed to open source - contributing to existing technologies, as well as open-sourcing our own software and tools for the benefit of the larger data and engineering community. Responsibilities:
Create and test applications and software frameworks to run and characterize/validate Big Data pipelines with a wide variety of data inputs, workloads, and APIs/interfaces.
Drive clarity and rigor in product definition.
Mentor junior software engineers and DevOps engineers.
Qualifications
Very comfortable with writing server-side applications,
Able to learn rapidly how to use and validate large system APIs/interfaces, especially APIs of Big Data systems (see Preferred Qualifications below).
Adept in working in Linux/UN*X environments.
Strong coding skills.
Preferred Experience:
Fluency in any of the following: Java, Python, SQL, Scala, or Ruby.
Understanding of REST APIs and how to validate their functionality, performance and reliability.
Prior experience with Spark/Cassandra/Hadoop/HDFS/Hive/Pig.
Prior hands-on experience with AWS: designing, deploying, and testing applications in AWS.
