Description
As a Senior Software Engineer in Quality in CTO Dev team, you will be responsible for working with product managers, marketers, developers and designers in our agile team structure. We love product engineers who lead the charge, with deep customer empathy, strong understanding of SaaS, and open source tools to deliver the most intuitive consumer products. Using your detailed understanding of technologies and applying your intellectual curiosity you will help shape, test, and improve the features that help our customers run their businesses easily every day.
Responsibilities:
Understanding of automation test methodologies, automation test frameworks, tools, and techniques, and practical application of test automation in major development efforts is required.
Employ advanced white box and automated testing techniques and technical expertise to develop test automation to test features and functionality at different levels in the technology stack to ensure delivery of a reliable, consistent, high quality and scalable product.
Apply defined software quality best practices and procedures to design, influence, and drive quality and testability of Intuit's software.
Work on complex projects that cover a wide range of technologies and interdependencies between platforms requiring analytical skills and innovative thinking ensuring quality of the overall software.
Serve in a technical leadership capacity by mentoring junior engineers and new team members, and by applying technical expertise to challenging programming and design problems relating to quality engineering.
Participate in design, architecture and code reviews to ensure testability and quality.
Design and implement test strategy for new projects.
Review functional and technical documentation in order to identify requirements for the creation of test plans, test cases and test scripts.
Conduct test case and test script reviews to ensure scenarios accurately capture business functionality.
Execute all components of product testing such as functional, regression, end-to-end testing, performance and load testing utilizing automation.
Validate the code in different environments and sign off quality on code delivery to production.
Develop new or enhance and extend existing data driven, tool agnostic test frameworks.
Develop modular and robust automated test scripts of GUI, WS, APIs, E2E utilizing domain specific language, exception handling, and other advanced automation techniques.
Conduct test automation reviews to ensure robustness, maintainability, extensibility, and scalability.
Add/maintain automated tests to Jenkins pipeline as part of CI pipeline.
Escalate issues as appropriate and track them to resolution.
Communicate and coordinate testing with offshore and local teams.
Make recommendations to improve product reliability, performance, and quality assurance best practices and processes.
Investigate and evaluate new testing technologies and products for application within the environment.
Experience with Agile Development, SCRUM, Test Driven Programming methodologies.
Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or any Engineering discipline is required.
5-7 years of hands on software development & complex products delivery experience with the passion for being at the leading edge of technology.
7+ years of programming experience in Java/J2EE, JavaScript or C++.
5+ years of experience using open source tools to deliver automation & implement C2D solutions (ex: JUnit, QUnit, Mockito, Mocha, TestNG, Selenium, Jenkins).
5+ years of experience testing large scale complex Web applications using Java/J2EE, Web Services (REST or SOAP), Java Script Frameworks, HTML, JSON, Tomcat, Mule, Node.js.
3+ years of experience in developing SaaS, Web applications and services using Agile software development methodologies.
Solid experience in understanding of systems architecture, deployment (preferably in AWS) and security.
5+ years of experience in testing nonfunctional requirements and recommending solutions (ex: JMeter, Jmocking, JRuby, Gatling).
Experience in developing Web Services and/or UI test frameworks.
Strong Business Acumen, self starter with excellent communication skills, ability to drive problems to a solution.

Description
Come join Intuit as a Senior Tax Analyst for Software Development. Tax Analysts are tax law domain experts who are Intuitâ€™s â€œgo-toâ€ù specialist for helping developing accurate and high-quality tax content. They apply deep understanding of income tax compliance in service to the development of tax preparation software for our Professional Tax Group customers, i.e., tax preparers across North America.
Tax Analysts develop requirements based on tax research, create tax scenarios and they validate that the tax software is in compliance with tax regulations. They may use specialized tools, templates and frameworks to:
Interpret tax laws into logical requirements that are used to create our tax offerings.
Develop business rules to ensure compliance with requirements
Analyze tax data to determine customer usage and impact, assess risks to tax scope and help develop risk mitigation strategies
Interact with customers and government agencies as Intuit forges strong relationships and partnerships
Regularly envisions, initiates and/or leads process and product improvements based on customer insights
Develop test cases based on tax scenarios and execute the scenarios to validate and verify accuracy and completeness of the software.

5-8 years income tax preparation or analysis experience
Comprehensive understanding and use of software best practices. Previous in-depth utilization of tax preparation software programs
Technical expertise used to mentor and coach junior Tax Analysts
Proficient in multiple tax domains
Strong understanding of federal and state taxation, preferably in multiple tax categories: Individual, business, non-profit, estates and trusts, etc.
Strong business analysis skills to communicate tax concepts to non-tax professionals
Communicate technical information at the appropriate level within the organization
Proficient at interpreting and communicating the most complex tax issues, as well as assessing the impact to developers and customers
Continually assess and drive process and tool improvements.
Comprehensive knowledge of all analyst tools
Able to effectively prioritize individual and team work to ensure delivery of the highest customer value
Enrolled Agent and/or CPA certification preferred
Positive â€œchange agentâ€ù mindsets: leadership, optimism, innovation, continuous improvement of work processes
Working knowledge of Object Oriented programming languages â€“ Java, C++, C#, Python--Preferred

Description
Come join the Intuit Central Technology Office (CTO) Data Extraction team as a Software Engineer.
We are a small team with the vision to change the way our customers interact with our products to import their financial data. With millions of Intuit customers using our software, you will be part of a cutting edge team that is responsible for building highly-scalable and distributed document extraction systems to enable financial data import. You will be working with a strong, motivated team of Software Engineers and Data Scientists to push the state of the art in this exciting space.

Deliver technical design and implement highly available, scalable, and secure web services with excellent quality in a fast paced agile environment.

Experience with design and development of robust and highly scalable web services or web applications in an agile environment
Experience with XML, REST, JSON, and security best practices required.
Excellent communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Skilled in software development lifecycle processes. Experience with SCRUM, Agile and iterative approaches a plus.
Team Player possessing strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills.

Experience with image processing tools (e.g. OpenCV)
Experience with machine learning tools and techniques

This team within the Small Business Group has the exciting charter of experimenting its way to great products and services and delivering an awesome experience to our customers. 5+ years of hands on coding experience; 2+ years of delivery experience with Agile software development methodologies
Solid experience in Object-Oriented Design and programming concepts in Java.

Description
Enterprise Business Service (EBS) runs the enterprise application platform that Intuit uses to perform all its business transactions. Sales and Care group within EBS is responsible for all applications related to customer facing application including CRM, IVR and knowledge management. The position is for experienced salesforce engineer to design and develop salesforce as an enterprise platform to support sales and care processes for multiple business units at Intuit.
Responsibilities
Core Salesforce application development using Salesforce tools to map business process, implement system automation and integration.
Full software development lifecycle from technical design to development, testing and deployment, including multiple concurrent Salesforce projects.
Apply best practices for customizing Salesforce.
Interact directly with solution designers, engineers and architect team to ensure Salesforce solutions are scalable.
Take responsibility for end-to-end solution delivery for their respective tracks.
Provide operations team with support and help troubleshoot system issue.
Qualifications
10+ years of technical experience with minimum 5+ years experience as a Salesforce developer (Expert level).

Advanced Salesforce user and administrator skills (including using permissions, roles, profile, queues, security setup, views, page layouts).
Experience in Salesforce Knowledge management, Salesforce community portal and Lightening Connector is plus.
Experience in SKUID UI development tool is a plus.
Previous experience opening and managing Salesforce.com bugs (troubleshooting etc).
Knowledge of Agile methodology and sprint based project delivery.
Demonstrated experience in working with geographically distributed teams, across time zones.
BS/BA Degree preferred or equivalent combination of technical certifications and experience.

Description
Intuit Australia landed on Australian shores in 2013 with QuickBooks Online (QBO) and was voted 3rd in BRW's Best Places to work in 2015. Intuit HQ is based in Mountain View California where we have been in operations since 1983. We are proud to share that Intuit has consistently appeared in Fortuneâ€™s top 50 Best companies to work for over the last 5 years.
We believe in the power of the individual. The power to do more. To make more. To be more. We're innovators, and have been at it for more than three decades. And we don't stand still. As the world evolves, so do we â€“ inventing new solutions to solve important problems, perfecting those solutions and delighting our customers. In short: Improving people's financial lives so profoundly they can't imagine going back to the old way.
The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.
As a Fullstack Developer, you will be working on the crux of our Product, QuickBooks Online, as our team focuses on Desktop Browsers. You may also be tasked with developing for Tablets and Mobile, as our consumers are diverse and our teams agile.
Not only will you be coding - you will be responsible for working with product managers, other developers and designers. We love Product Engineers who lead the charge, communicating with customers and delivering the most beautiful, intuitive application possible is a must.
The team is tasked with developing the next gen application from the ground up and we get our choice of UI tools to accomplish the task. If you love expansive goals and real world challenges, while fostering the need for innovation, delivering an awesome user experience through perfect code and world class user experience, this is the job for you.
Responsibilities:
Â· Be comfortable working with cross geography and cross functional teams
Â· Develop a Single Page Application and the required backend services using JavaScript, CSS, Node.js and Java technologies for QuickBooks Online
Qualifications
Required Skills and Experience
1+ years of professional or open-source experience writing JavaScript (not just jQuery)
1+ years of professional or open-source experience writing RESTful APIs and middle tier coding in Node.js, Java, Python or C++
Agile coding experience, working in small teams that have made a big impact fast
Familiarity with standard javascript async patterns (events, closures, callbacks, promises, error handling, etc.)
Strong CS fundamentals and an object oriented language (think an undergrad CS degree, or similar amount of work experience)
Never ending desire to self-educate on the latest list of web technologies like HTML, CSS, javascript frameworks and bleeding edge browser features/idiosyncrasies
Preferred Skills and Experience
1+ years of professional or open-source experience with a JavaScript MVC toolkit in a Single Page Architecture. Most notably React framework but also including AngularJS, Dojo, Backbone.js, Knockout or Ember.js.
1+ years of experience with CSS framework such as LESS, Sass, etc.
Similar experience in a modern consumer environment (Pinterest, Box, Quora, Facebook) and/or open source projects (contributed to node.js, dojo toolkit, NPM modules, etc)
Experience with GIT SCM
Passion for user experience and strong design experience
Firm grasp of framework URL based routing principles
Experience with a data visualization package (Highcharts, d3.js, etc.)
Experience with accounting or financial application
Experience writing Tablet or Mobile applications

Description

The SBG Data Engineering team is looking for a Software Engineer II with a winning track record in Big Data and Distributed Systems. Weâ€™re using data in groundbreaking ways to uncover customer insights, personalize customer experiences, and provide a unified customer view across all SBG products.

Description
The CTO Dev Mobile and Semantic Technology and Search (STS) team is looking for a strong DevOps engineer with a passion for automation, capable of tackling the complex problems of high availability and scale which are unique to Intuit, while leveraging your expertise in AWS, operations, automation, configuration management, distributed systems, and databases.
As a Staff Application Operations Engineer, you will ensure service scalability and reliability for various key Intuit platform services, at the same time, enabling fast deployments and delivery, with an eye towards automation, while providing guidance on a small, high performing DevOps team. This would entail providing 24/7 application support, incident management, debugging and troubleshooting operations processes to resolve defects and provide root cause analysis for the Mobile and STS services in production and non-production environments hosted primarily in AWS as well as in Intuit data centers. You will be a primary escalation point to resolve complex production issues being worked on by the team. You will also review product requirements and architecture to understand and implement operational standards and capabilities.
Responsibilities:
Applies full understanding of the business, the customer, and the solutions that a business offers to effectively design, develop, and implement operational capabilities, tools and processes that enable highly available, scalable & reliable customer experiences.
Utilizes deep knowledge of operations engineering, connected services, and system administration plus knowledge of industry best practices to innovate and influence operational approaches and solutions.
Maintain and improve the availability, performance, scalability and efficiency of the services by implementing monitoring, automation, redundancy, capacity and business-continuity planning.
Automation and development of operations tools, application dashboards, etc.
Metrics reporting on applications performance, availability, reliability, etc.
Develop and implement automated deployments.
Implementation and design of configuration management.
Troubleshoot issues and participate in 24x7 on-call support, ensuring the stability and performance of the production environment.
Review and development of performance and capacity plans (operational capacity and load requirements).
Facilitate the creation of the Operational readiness documents.
Coaches and mentors other application operations engineers.
Coordinates technical dependencies with other teams.
Technical lead for complex projects.
Drive the end-to-end incident management process.
Develop and automate monitoring processes.
Oversee change management and configuration management operating mechanisms.
Drive root cause analysis (RCA) and risk management processes.
Drive ongoing improvements and efficiencies in operational practices, tools & processes BU and Intuit-wide.
Qualifications
B.S. or higher in Computer Science or 8+ years of equivalent knowledge and experience.
Strong communication skills (verbal and written).
Passion and talent for advanced scripting and automation (e.g. Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, C, Golang, etc.).
Expert knowledge of managing services in AWS.
Expertise in Linux/Unix system administration.
Significant experience managing highly available services at scale.
Significant experience with configuration management (e.g. Chef, Salt, Puppet, CloudFormation, etc.) and automated deployments.
Experience with CI/CD process and technologies (e.g. Jenkins, Travis CI, etc.).
Strong knowledge and experience with metrics, monitoring and alerting tools (e.g. New Relic, Splunk, OMD/Nagios, Sensu, PagerDuty, etc.).
Experience in support/troubleshooting/operations of relational and NOSQL databases (e.g. MySQL, Postgres, Oracle, RDS, Cassandra, Dynamo DB, etc.).
Operational mindset with ability to do incident, problem, change, and SLA management.
Expert problem solving capabilities and ability to think outside the box.
Works well in a fast-paced, dynamic operations environment with geographically distributed teams.
Experience in supporting and maintaining Java applications.
Experience with Tomcat, JBoss, Mule.

Description
Are you looking for a new challenge? Looking for hard problems to solve?
Be responsible for developing and implementing security solutions for Intuit's next generation cloud hosting environment. An ideal candidate is a creative self-starter with an integrator mindset that can work autonomously to develop creative solutions as part of a cloud security platform. The candidate will work within an engineering team to design, develop, and implement automation to support cloud hosting solutions at scale in support of protecting infrastructure and applications to meet strict requirements for security, functionality, scalability, performance and reliability. Furthermore the candidate must be an expert with a hands-on ability to demonstrate how solutions will work, develop prototypes, perform research and development activities, and assist in large-scale implementation, as needed.
This is an exciting position supporting some of our new and emerging initiatives. Youâ€™ll enjoy working with the best and brightest in this space and your efforts will help our teams to learn more as we innovate.
The candidate will have extensive experience working with large-scale applications, virtualization and cloud deployments, while remaining vendor agnostic; skilled in seeing past vendor sales discussions to engineer a durable environment. They should be able to develop custom solutions to help protect applications and infrastructure from common and targeted threat vectors. This person should be an expert with cloud principles like horizontal scale, networking concepts like routing, filtering, and proxy technologies. Interest in how controls will work at a deep level and having extensive knowledge of host and application security controls is a must. The Cloud Security Developer is able to architect and develop code to automate solutions for security challenges and they can work with others to give life to their applications.

Description
Innovating. Empowering. Delighting.
Intuit Australia landed on Australian shores in 2013 with QuickBooks Online (QBO) and was voted 3rd in BRW's Best Places to work in 2015. Intuit HQ is based in Mountain View California where we have been in operations since 1983.
We are proud to share that Intuit has consistently appeared in Fortuneâ€™s top 50 Best companies to work for over the last 5 yearsâ€_
We believe in the power of the individual. The power to do more. To make more. To be more.
We're innovators, and have been at it for more than three decades. And we don't stand still. As the world evolves, so do we â€“ inventing new solutions to solve important problems, perfecting those solutions and delighting our customers. In short: Improving people's financial lives so profoundly they can't imagine going back to the old way.
The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.
Come join the Small Business Offerings Marketing Team as a Staff Software Engineer in Quality, and help in restructuring and redesigning the QuickBooks marketing site. Intuitâ€™s Small Business Group is seeking a passionate, highly collaborative quality staff engineer to work on our Marketing website development team for QuickBooks. This position will be responsible for driving changes in the way we run and manage our marketing site with high quality solutions using the bleeding edge technologies.
You will be able to apply the mastery of software engineering to design, influence and drive quality and testability of products and services. If you love having big goals and real world challenges, while fostering the need for innovation and delivering an awesome user experience, this is the job for you.
You will be responsible for working with product managers, marketers, developers and designers in our agile team structure. We love product engineers who lead the charge, with deep customer empathy, strong understanding of SaaS, and open source tools to deliver the most intuitive consumer products. Using your detailed understanding of technologies and applying your intellectual curiosity you will help shape, test, and improve the features that help our customers run their businesses easily every day.
Responsibilities:
Test Design: Test strategize, test plan and test case creation in providing test coverage across various products, systems, and platforms
Test Automation: Design and implement reusable automated test frameworks to drive test automation goals and to support continuous integration and regression testing. Utilize and extend existing test automation test harnesses
Agile Development: Understand and practice QA functions in an agile development cycle using Scrum process. Conduct early project scoping and collaborate with cross-functional teams in identifying testability goals across n-tier platforms
QA Best Practice: Stay abreast of industry test tools and best testing practices while making significant contributions to the development and deployment of various project releases. Provide mentorship and training to junior QA engineers.
Risk Mitigation: Anticipate and mitigate test and project issues through risk analysis and assessment
Defect Tracking/Reporting: Provide accurate and reproducible qualitative defect reporting, bug scrubs, and quality metrics with project core teams
Qualifications
BS/Masters in Computer Science or Engineering degree.
8+ years of software quality experience testing analytical systems
3+ years building test automation frameworks
Thorough knowledge of test methodologies such as: static (verification and validation) and dynamic, black, white, grey box, automated regression, build verification, load
Strong analytic skills, creative, and detail oriented
A self-starter that is proactive, and highly motivated
Excellent communication skills
Proficient with programming in an OOP language like Java, C++
Proficient with programming in any scripting language like Javascript, Ruby, Python or Perl
Proficient with Unix/Linux systems
Experience with bug tracking tools and version control systems (Jira/Perforce/SVN/Bugzilla/GIT/GitFlow)
Provides technical leadership, develops product expertise and advocates on behalf of the customer
Coordinates dependencies with other teams
Defines Quality Strategy
Must be comfortable working with cross geography and cross functional teams
Experience in leading technical activities for complex projects
Familiar with Agile Methodologies like Scrum
Influences organizational goals beyond a specific project
Public presentations at internal events
Required experience:
Familiarity with JUnit, Selenium, Jenkins, TestNg, RESTful WS testing
Familiarity with Saucelabs
Familiarity with CI/D process and tool sets and frameworks
Familiarity with testing in AWS
Preferred experience:
Familiarity with Javascript, Javascript test framework (Mocha, Intern etc.)
Familiar with mobile development platforms and toolkits (Android SDK, Apple iOS/xCode, Appium, Selendroid, Calabash, etc.)

Description
Minimize Risk Through Education:
Plan, organize and manage technical training and awareness projects in collaboration with Information Security Leaders and team members across IIS and PD business lines.
Presentation of secure software development topics to the Engineering community
Providing Instructor Led Training related to Architectural Threat Modeling, Secure Code Reviews, Defensive Programming, etc.
Leading hands-on workshops to demonstrate the use of Security Tools and Services
Instructional design of new training content suitable for online or instructor led format
Develop innovative content delivery methods that appeal to the product development community
Driving Intuit Information Security best practices across our engineering community
Partnering with the development community across Intuit to understand specific training needs
Acting as the technical subject matter expert: Mentoring fellow engineers, demonstrating technical expertise
Generate technical documentation and presentations to communicate secure architecture and design
Monitor and identify the top human risks to our organization and the behaviors we need to change to mitigate those risks.
Ensure that our program is effectively changing behaviors so our employees act in a secure manner, reducing the most risk to our organization. In addition identify if any roles require additional or more specialized training and ensure those roles receive it.
Create a positive program that engages employees and contractors, using interactive and innovative audio and video learning experiences.
Leverage opportunities alongside IIS Communications, to expand employee knowledge through remedial training, campaigns, education fairs and events.
Structure and maintain the program to be long term, so ultimately we are not changing just behaviors but creating a culture of security.
Operating Rhythms & Process:
Inform leadership of plans and results supporting our operating rhythms such as internal & external regulatory audits, KPIs and metrics to ensure we are effectively communicating how weâ€™re making the company more secure.
Proactively manage and own the operational tasks, such as working with ILN (Intuitâ€™s Learning Management System) support and reports for the department.
Evaluate, plan and establish budget, working with leadership as part of the Strategic Planning Process. Participate in ongoing budget reviews pertaining to Information Security training, and help identify risks and opportunities.
Operational Alignment:
Work closely with Information Security Leaders and team members in all business units and functions to align training with strategy.
Partner with stakeholders to understand their business training needs and provide consultation and advice on the recommended training solutions.
Effect results by maneuvering through appropriate formal and informal organization channels.
I. POSITION REQUIREMENTS In order to be successful, the ideal candidate must be, without a doubt, passionate about our customers, partners, stakeholders, and technology. Conduct formal and informal Training Needs Analysis, anticipating future training demands and develop plans accordingly to meet the needs of Intuitâ€™s business lines. Excellent interpersonal skills, communication, and leadership skills, and ability to build rapport and credibility with multiple stakeholders across the organization is vital to the success of this role. The ideal candidate will have the following qualities:
Experience working in an Information Security environment and demonstrable understanding of the concepts of information risks and the different elements that make up risk. Previous experience of compliance programs and regulatory obligations is a plus.
Experience with Agile Development or DevOps methodologies
Demonstrable knowledge of the policies and principals of information handling and protection.
Excellent communication skills, including written, verbal, and design skills with demonstrable competence and experience in clearly explaining complex information security concepts and technologies for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Practical knowledge of various learning styles and a variety of awareness techniques to reduce the â€˜human factorsâ€™ risk.
Demonstrable experience with the process of eLearning design and development is a must. Experience developing eLearning using current industry tools is a plus.
The ability to work under pressure, prioritize workflows, meet targets and escalate when appropriate.
Effective negotiation skills in all mediums and throughout all levels of the organization
Strong ability to work with minimum direction and high drive for results
Business Support: In an environment where information security might be viewed as a barrier to growth, this candidate must have a demonstrated ability to anticipate the needs of the business, proven ability to support a fast-paced business and demonstrated ability to understand and balance business demands with the need for providing awareness and training opportunities. Candidates must have a track record of the ability to work effectively in a matrix environment, work as a team player and manage multiple stakeholders. Innovative Thinking: This candidate should have a demonstrated ability to lead with innovative ideas. S/he will be an â€œout-of-the-boxâ€ù thinker and possess the passion to learn and adapt to evolving training methodologies. Strategic Thinker: Ability to think and plan holistically, end-to-end across multiple time horizons and multiple business lines. Work with Information Security teams, Business Leaders and the Cyber Security Team to define training requirements and lead the development and implementation of training to meet those requirements. Must understand the need to address specific risks based on job roles combined with the needs of all business stakeholders.
Qualifications
BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience
8+ years information security experience in the design and development of web, software, or mobile applications.
Strong leadership experience: Leading meetings, presenting, technical go to person, and cross-functional leader.
Security expertise with developing in any of the following Languages: Node.js, JavaScript, C/C++/C#.
Expertise with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) in an Agile environment.
3+ years experience with securing web services (consuming or creating) with REST or SOAP.
AWS or other IaaS expertise
Excellent communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Expertise in the secure software design/architecture process.

Description
Come join the Intuitâ€™s Canada Tax Quality team as an experienced Senior Software Developer in Quality.
Intuit is a leader in delivering awesome customer experiences in the personal and professional tax software space.
Intuitâ€™s Canada Tax Group is leader in building personal and professional tax software. We innovate and simplify customer experience for multiple tax offerings including TurboTax, SnapTax, and ProFile.
The Canada Tax Quality team is responsible for designing, developing, executing and automating functional and non-functional tests, filing defects, assisting in root cause analysis of defects, driving the resolution of defects, monitoring regression test case runs. You will be assuming the role of the customer. To that point, you will be directly responsible in helping to prevent issues from reaching our customers and improve efficiency of team.
In this role you will be able to apply the mastery of software engineering to design, influence and drive quality, testability and automation feasibility of products and services. Using your detailed understanding of technologies and applying your intellectual curiosity you will help shape design, implementation and testability of the features that help our customers run their businesses easily every day.
Successful candidate will be highly technical, passionate, quick-learner, self-motivated, analytical, detail-oriented, and ready to become a key contributor in short time. If you have a passion and desire to make a positive impact to the company bottom line in an agile environment, this is the place for you.

Experienced at testing, automating web-services and SaaS/Desktop based solutions

Description
As a Senior Software Engineer in Quality in CTO Dev team, you will be responsible for working with product managers, marketers, developers and designers in our agile team structure. We love product engineers who lead the charge, with deep customer empathy, strong understanding of SaaS, and open source tools to deliver the most intuitive consumer products. Using your detailed understanding of technologies and applying your intellectual curiosity you will help shape, test, and improve the features that help our customers run their businesses easily every day.
Responsibilities:
Understanding of automation test methodologies, automation test frameworks, tools, and techniques, and practical application of test automation in major development efforts is required.
Employ advanced white box and automated testing techniques and technical expertise to develop test automation to test features and functionality at different levels in the technology stack to ensure delivery of a reliable, consistent, high quality and scalable product.
Apply defined software quality best practices and procedures to design, influence, and drive quality and testability of Intuit's software.
Work on complex projects that cover a wide range of technologies and interdependencies between platforms requiring analytical skills and innovative thinking ensuring quality of the overall software.
Serve in a technical leadership capacity by mentoring junior engineers and new team members, and by applying technical expertise to challenging programming and design problems relating to quality engineering.
Participate in design, architecture and code reviews to ensure testability and quality.
Design and implement test strategy for new projects.
Review functional and technical documentation in order to identify requirements for the creation of test plans, test cases and test scripts.
Conduct test case and test script reviews to ensure scenarios accurately capture business functionality.
Execute all components of product testing such as functional, regression, end-to-end testing, performance and load testing utilizing automation.
Validate the code in different environments and sign off quality on code delivery to production.
Develop new or enhance and extend existing data driven, tool agnostic test frameworks.
Develop modular and robust automated test scripts of GUI, WS, APIs, E2E utilizing domain specific language, exception handling, and other advanced automation techniques.
Conduct test automation reviews to ensure robustness, maintainability, extensibility, and scalability.
Add/maintain automated tests to Jenkins pipeline as part of CI pipeline.
Escalate issues as appropriate and track them to resolution.
Communicate and coordinate testing with offshore and local teams.
Make recommendations to improve product reliability, performance, and quality assurance best practices and processes.
Investigate and evaluate new testing technologies and products for application within the environment.
Experience with Agile Development, SCRUM, Test Driven Programming methodologies.
Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or any Engineering discipline is required.
5-7 years of hands on software development & complex products delivery experience with the passion for being at the leading edge of technology.
7+ years of programming experience in Java/J2EE, JavaScript or C++.
5+ years of experience using open source tools to deliver automation & implement C2D solutions (ex: JUnit, QUnit, Mockito, Mocha, TestNG, Selenium, Jenkins).
5+ years of experience testing large scale complex Web applications using Java/J2EE, Web Services (REST or SOAP), Java Script Frameworks, HTML, JSON, Tomcat, Mule, Node.js.
3+ years of experience in developing SaaS, Web applications and services using Agile software development methodologies.
Solid experience in understanding of systems architecture, deployment (preferably in AWS) and security.
5+ years of experience in testing nonfunctional requirements and recommending solutions (ex: JMeter, Jmocking, JRuby, Gatling).
Experience in developing Web Services and/or UI test frameworks.
Strong Business Acumen, self starter with excellent communication skills, ability to drive problems to a solution.

Description
Job Description: Intuit is looking for a Senior Software engineer to help drive our build, test, and deployment pipeline to the next level. The right person for the job will love high quality software and automation and have a passion for delivering for customers. Their job will entail designing and implementing an application that integrates with multiple deployment systems, tools, and other applications to create the capability in the organization to seamlessly build, test, deploy and track releases. Responsibilities:
Understand application and service architectures and design solutions to improve the build and release cycles
Communicate with users, other technical leaders, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and architect technical designs
Implement designs and provide technical leadership and expertise during the development phase
Troubleshoot issues that develop in an application
Create RESTful web services using Java
Write code in Java, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS that meets the functional specifications
Propose and evaluate changes to the deployment architecture to improve performance, scalability, and/or manageability
Experience writing RESTful web services
Solve complex problems and provide clear and concise recommendations
Evaluating and identifying appropriate technical solutions
Qualifications
5+ years experience as a software engineer
1+ years managing/leading a technical team
Have a curiosity and passion for crafting amazing experiences
Demonstrate excellent communication skills and ability to explain your technical architecture designs
Expert programmer in Java
Front-end web development experience with HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3 is desirable
Professional technical experience, preferably in software engineering or DevOps â€“ with aspects of continuous integration of large scale web application

Strong development experience with JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, React, etc.)
Strong development experience with UI testing frameworks (Selenium, Protractor, Jest, etc.)
Experience testing RESTful web services
Experience with unit testing & Test First Development (TDD, BDD, ATDD)
Experience with test isolation (JMockit, WireMock, Mockito)
Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong understanding of software design/architecture processes
Self-directed and self-motivated individual who takes complete ownership of the product and its outcome
